text.author: MTSAMPLES.COM
text.title: Followup Screw Fixation
text.summary1: (human1) A 59-year-old man's followup 4 months post percutaneous screw fixation of a right Schatzker IV tibial plateau fracture and 2nd-5th metatarsal head fractures shows good pain control and incision and fracture healing, but decreased foot sensation (L4-L5 distribution bilaterally) and bridging callus, recommending physical therapy and neurologist/surgeon if paresthesias worsen.
text.summary2: (claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022) 59-year-old male presents for 4-month followup after percutaneous screw fixation of right Schatzker IV tibial plateau fracture and nonoperative treatment of metatarsal fractures, showing good healing and range of motion but with bilateral foot paresthesias, and is advised to continue physical therapy with followup in 2 months.
text.summary3: (gpt4o) This follow-up report for a 59-year-old male, four months after percutaneous screw fixation of a Schatzker IV tibial plateau fracture and nonoperative treatment of metatarsal head fractures, shows healing progress, controlled pain, and ongoing physical therapy, with plans to address new bilateral foot paresthesias and continue rehabilitation.
text.summary4: (Meta-Llama-3-8B-Instruct) A 59-year-old man, 4 months post-p Percutaneous screw fixation of a right tibial plateau fracture and nonoperative management of metatarsal head fractures, is assessed for follow-up, with his pain well-controlled, but experiencing bilateral foot paresthesias due to spinal stenosis with lower extremity neuropathy.
text.summary5: (Qwen2.5-3B-Instruct; postedited) A 59-year-old male follows up 4 months post-surgery for fractures, showing improved healing and strength, with concerns of persistent paresthesias, scheduled to see neurologist or spinal surgeon if symptoms progess.
